page.title: 17WILBERFOSS ENERGY USAGE
page.content: In Wilberfoss the types of energy used for heating and cooking vary considerably. 100 people were asked which types of energy they used for heating and cooking. For heating 42.3% used coal, 17.5% used electricity, 6.2% used bottled gas, 10.7% used wood burning stoves and 23.1% used oil. The results for cooking were as below 90.3% used electricity, 3.8% used bottled gas and 5.8% used solid fuel. For both heating and cooking most people used more than one type of energy. At the moment there is no piped natural gas in the village because it is too expensive to put in. It would cost Â£250,000 in 1985 to lay the necessary pipes. The nearest natural gas pipes are some 4 miles away at Dunnington. Most people were satis- fied with the present energy systems.
